Articles.Content:
Is there a way, when you are building a rocket that you can load 2 rockets/rovers/probes whatever, like you load a rocket and you load a rover in the same room?

Thanks
It's possible as long as you rovers are connected to eachother in the VAB/SPH and you decouple them with a sepatron on launch.

Without mods, you can only load 1 craft. If you load something else, it will delete whatever was in the VAB already.

You need subassambly loader mod to do this

Without mods, you can only load 1 craft. If you load something else, it will delete whatever was in the VAB already.

You need subassambly loader mod to do this

But that mod doesn't seem to exist on the spaceport.

The fix for it was here, but for some reason the links are gone...

Sorry, that's the only idea I had. Without it you'll have to lead your basic rocket and build a rover under it, or vice versa

Here's the new mod to replace subassembly loader

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/38285-0-20-x-Subassembly-Manager

...for some reason the links are gone...

Copyright reasons. The author of SAL seems to have vanished, the source code has no licensing info, and the release thread (which supposedly* mentioned the license) got lost in the forum crash.

*This is post-crash hearsay, I haven't been here long

*This is post-crash hearsay, I haven't been here long

There's enough of this floating around it makes me wish I'd been in on the forum pre-crash just so I could talk about the juicy stuff with authority. *sigh*

There's enough of this floating around it makes me wish I'd been in on the forum pre-crash just so I could talk about the juicy stuff with authority. *sigh*

I know how you feel.
